phoenix.impl

Class RemoteAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • phoenix.impl.RemoteAPI

  • public class RemoteAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    Remote API is a helper API class for helping Remote devices (Web, Android, iOS, etc). The APIs included here are basically "convenience" apis to make the communication with the remote device easier.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteAPI()

      boolean DeleteSystemMessage(java.lang.String message, long startTime, long endTime)

    • Method Detail

      • DeleteSystemMessage

        public boolean DeleteSystemMessage(java.lang.String message,
                                   long startTime,
                                   long endTime)
        Since you cannot delete a system message by ID, this is a convenience method for finding and then deleting a system message by name and time. This is mainly used by remote systems, such as web ui, or android for deleting messages.
        Parameters:
        message -
        startTime -
        endTime -
        Returns:

      • GetSystemMessages

        public java.util.List GetSystemMessages()
        Returns the System Messages as a List containing a Map of elements that represent the System Message. This is meant as a convenience method that creates a structure that can easily be serialized for json transport.
        Returns:

      • SearchMediaByTitle

        public java.util.List<IMediaResource> SearchMediaByTitle(java.lang.String titleContains,
                                                         java.lang.String baseViewName)
        Searches a given view for a title containing the passed title string. If TV files are used, then both the TITLE adn the EPISODENAME is searched.
        Parameters:
        titleContains -
        baseViewName -
        Returns:

      • SearchMediaByActor

        public java.util.List<IMediaResource> SearchMediaByActor(java.lang.String actorContains,

        Searches a given view for all media files that contain the given "actor" criteria.
        Parameters:
        actorContains -
        baseViewName -
